page.title: 03A VISIT TO THE SILVERSMITH.
page.content: This morning we went to see a lady silversmith who works in the village. She has got a workshop, in her home, that was a stable a long time ago.She said she got her silver from a{bullion {dealer in Birmingham,}and that sheets of silver were{Â£8.50 an ounce, or {Â£4.50 an ounce for scrap.}Silver comes mostly from South America, South Africa and Australia.She showed us her work bench and told us that the bench had two round bits cut out of it so she could get near to her work. A lamp by the bench gave a good light.There was a peg sticking out of the bench on which she could put her work so it would not move about.When she wanted to join two pieces of silver together she would solder them with silver solder, called a flux,that is made from silver and another metal.
